page.title: 02Rural to Urban Chelmsford.
page.content: The oldest part of the district is {Duke Street}where Georgian facades are still to be seen,though they now front shops and offices instead of houses. Here too is the local{Railway Station, built in 1843 on a viaduct of eighteen brick arches, and now believed to handle the highest percentage of daily commuters to{London}per head of population in the country. Nestling in the shadow of the station and its attendant goods yard are the{Marconi}and{Hoffmann}(now{ {Ransome,Hoffmann and Pollard}) factories, the former excelling in the field of{radio}and{electronics}and the latter a leader in the{Ball and {Roller Bearing}industry.Built around the turn of the last century,these establishments were to prove the focal point of the change of character of the area from{rural to urban.
